issue.title: fix #19130

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Fixed issues  | #19130

body: Ah, so it's not just the tests. Another reason to not make special cases for tests in the code.
Well it's unlikely you're calling regenerateid in production code while no session was saved yet. It's not invalid though..
Btw check my PR, I think it fixes it in a clean way for all cases.
Hm, looks like tests are failing.

Hmm, looking into it some more makes me feel like it's quite hacky anyway. 
We're essentially caching the `composeFields()` call in session close because it doesn't work well afterwards etc; very ugly! I'll have a fix ready soon.

@bizley I've reworked it a bit more; let me explain my reasoning.

1. PHP may call `writeSession` when the session is closed (as a consequence of closing the session), but also when it is opened (as a consequence of regenerating the session).
2. The current `DbSession` will call the write callback, mostly with an open session, except in some cases. Note that the way this is currently implemented means any external session management via the normal PHP functions like `session_regenerate_id()` and more importantly `session_write_close` breaks configurations that uses a write callback.

I've updated the code to:
1. Intercept the `regenerateID()` function in the same way as `close()`.
2. I've updated the `writeSession` callback to call the callback if it wasn't called via the interception earlier


What I have not fixed, and cannot fix is this case:
1. Session is closed from PHP, so not via `->close()`.
2. You have a `writeCallback` that reads from the session.

This case is not fixable without breaking BC.

When looking at the function regenerateID of DbSession, it should follow the signature from Session's regenerateID
```php
    /**
     * Updates the current session ID with a newly generated one.
     *
     * Please refer to <https://www.php.net/session_regenerate_id> for more details.
     *
     * This method has no effect when session is not [[getIsActive()|active]].
     * Make sure to call [[open()]] before calling it.
     *
     * @param bool $deleteOldSession Whether to delete the old associated session file or not.
     * @see open()
     * @see isActive
     */
```
so when lookup via db session table and found no record, which is no active session with id (from session_id()) then it should ignore the call. Hence the branch of else `// shouldn't reach here normally` should be omit IMHO.

issue.title: Resolve #19130

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Fixed issues  | #19130 

The PR resolves issue #19130, the DbSession's regenerateID should follow Session's regenerateID signature to do nothing if no active sessionID exists.

issue.title: Session id is regenerated at alomst every request IN "dev" ENVIRONMENT

labels.name: expired
labels.description: Information requested was not provided in two weeks.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
<!--
Please use this issue tracker for bugs and feature requests only. In case you need support please use one of
Yii communities listed at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/wiki/communities
-->
**NOTE: This problem happen when using rest Api.
**NOTE: This problem does not happen when running the app in "prod" ENVIRONMENT.

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Just set the app to run in dev environment, and check the session id which sent back to the browser.

### What is the expected result?
Getting the same session by every request even in den environment

### What do you get instead?
I get diffrent session by every request.

### Additional info
Possible check point:
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/12763a146ebc550963b5d368633539701e7884ec
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/commit/12763a146ebc550963b5d368633539701e7884ec#r62888201
| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.44
| PHP version      | 7.4.30
| Operating system | Ubuntu 20.04
